intro: Matelea pilosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features broad, velvety leaves and produces showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Matelea pilosa is adapted to arid environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
